topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bef562636872024b322300#post_54bef562636872024b322300
[bq="Number1pegasus"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bef39763687212f0bc0300#post_54bef39763687212f0bc0300
Like they say, there's no such thing as bad publicity. [/bq]
There is such a thing as bad publicity, rather most of the time whenever the news tries to create a moral panic they most of the time go the route of "don't do this cool thing".  Geek culture is already insanely popular in the usa; if 24/7 news tries to create another moral panic the long term fallout would be geek culture would be propelled so far in popularity that chances are you'd see people show up to work in cosplay and it be considered normal.


What do I mean by this?  Well let's look at video games; video games are fucking insanely popular in the usa.  The best estimate of how many people play video games, excluding cellphone games or facebook games and such, is 200 million out of the 310 million people living in the usa.  The reason why it doesn't seem nearly as much is because most of those 200 million people only play video games once in a while and by no means are hardcore gamers; like they have a couple games that they love and play on a regular basis but they are in no way dropping forty hours a week on the game, sure they'll play five or so hours a week playing games but they're still playing video games.

Anyways that was just to illustrate a point; things mainstream culture in the usa deems to be geeky are *WAY* the fuck more popular than 24/7 news realize.  IF 24/7 news in the usa declares a culture war on geek culture then they would be declaring a culture war on the supermajority of the usa population and that will be hilarious.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54beff1e6368724deab92c00#post_54beff1e6368724deab92c00
The special effects in Avatar were good. As a travelogue of alien planet its certainly fine, but as an action movie...

Well the plot is a trite cliche, and a mildly offensive one at that (white guy becomes immersed in native culture, becomes their hero because none of the natives could stand up to da eeeeevil white guys), the only character I found believable was Sigourney Weaver's and frankly I find the Na'avi and Pandora in general a bit to twee and hippy-ish for my liking.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bef2446368724d6c372400#post_54bef2446368724d6c372400
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]So for context, my now ex-boyfriend bought me the Metal Gear Solid Legacy Collection for my PS3 for christmas one year. Now I have never played MGS 4. I've seen friends play it but that's about it. WHY THE FUCK DOES IT TAKE SIXTEEN MINUTES TO INSTALL?![/bq]
Because playstation 3. I think it's something to do with how the ram in the system works. 
Installations like that are what can make ps3 games look absolutely beautiful but it also apparently makes it a pain in the ass to develop for. 

Also be ready for two or three more installations later in the game
